alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:28AM PST until December 24 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of one half to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph, except up to 80 mph from Crown Point to Corbett. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM PST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Expect power outages and tree damage due to the ice. Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sleet and freezing rain in the western Columbia River Gorge should transition to mainly freezing rain by late Friday morning. Snow and sleet in the central Gorge and Upper Hood River Valley should transition to mainly freezing rain Friday evening. Another round of freezing rain is expected on Saturday through the western and central Gorge and the Upper Hood River Valley, resulting in significant total ice accumulations. Temperatures should finally warm above freezing Saturday night in the western Gorge and Sunday morning in the central Gorge and Upper Hood River Valley.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Western Columbia River Gorge
